etymology.description: Depicts a person kneeling or a child -> represents finishing or ending by representing completion of an action -> also interpreted as understanding or ability through context
etymology.interpretation: The character 了(了) (liǎo, 'end; finish; able to; understand') visually resembles a person in a kneeling position, symbolizing completion or conclusion. This association has extended over time to include meanings related to capability and understanding.

examples.chinese: 会议结束了(會議結束了)。
他听懂了我的建议(他聽懂了我的建議)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tīng dǒng liǎo wǒ de jiànyì.

examples.chinese: 我做完作业了(我做完作業了)，就去休息了(就去休息了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuò wán zuòyè liǎo, jiù qù xiūxí liǎo.
examples.english: I finished my homework, and then I went to rest.
